activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deonte X. Flowers

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 8, 2022 at 10:45 am.

3:03 PM Defendant Deonte X. Flowers appeared in custody by video.  Attorney Jason D Sanders appeared by video for Deonte X. Flowers. Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell and intern Verity Altenberger  appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Not guilty plea entered by Attorney Sanders. Remand to branch 7 for scheduling.

10:17 AM Defendant Deonte X. Flowers appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jason D Sanders appeared by video for Deonte X. Flowers.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. State rests, move for bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.
Arraignment scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 27, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

9:40 AM Defendant Deonte X. Flowers appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Jason D Sanders appeared by video for Deonte X. Flowers.  Attorney David S Olson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Victim J.E.H. appears by video. Deputy Zachary Anacker sworn in and testified by video. Witness identified Defendant. Attorney Sanders calls victim J.E.H. to testify. Court continues matter for victim to speak with an attorney before he testifies. Continued preliminary hearing scheduled on September 27, 2022 at 10:15 AM. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:24 AM Defendant Deonte X. Flowers appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jason D Sanders appeared by video for Deonte X. Flowers.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Parties address bond. Court denies bond modification.

03:31 PM  Defendant Deonte X. Flowers appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jason D Sanders appeared by video for Deonte X. Flowers.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White and intern Verity Altenberger  appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing requested within time limits by zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 3:28 PM Defendant Deonte X. Flowers appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for Deonte X. Flowers.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond of $25,000 set with conditions of no contact directly or indirectly with Co-defendant Makayla M Berg, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Not to possess any weapons. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 3:00pm.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
